comment.author: 24469639@N00
comment._content: Can this be geotagged?  And is any of it left, and visible on Streetview?

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: 54-58 Carrington Street according to City of Sydney Archives. Nothing of it survives. Demolished c.1928-29 during excavations for Wynyard Station.

comment.author: 20958381@N08
comment._content: The Imperial was built in the mid 1850s at what is now 56 - 58 Carrington St when it was known as Wynyard Square East. It was not originally a hotel and even contained the Sydney Council for a couple of years. It became a licensed hotel in 1875 and was not named the Imperial until 1913. By 1919 it was a warehouse for the wholesaler next door. The terraces were slowly demolished throughout the early 20th century and the former Imperial Hotel was demolished in the early 1920s. This image was used in Sydney's pubs exhibition at the Justice & Police Museum in 2008. Some more images can be seen here: www3.photosau.com/cos1/scripts/ExtSearch.asp?SearchTerm=0... acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=53246 And this is what was built after: acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=8375
